metadata.description: Comprehensive Multidimensional Quality Metrics (MQM) error taxonomy for translation quality assessment following W3C standards
sources: MQM-Chat: Multidimensional Quality Metrics for Chat Translation (2024)
ACL/EMNLP 2024-2025 Conference Papers on Translation Evaluation
metadata.usage: Use for translation error classification and MQM score calculation

mqm_overview.definition: MQM (Multidimensional Quality Metrics) is a comprehensive framework for measuring translation quality using detailed, multidimensional error categorization
mqm_overview.purpose: Provides standardized approach to translation quality assessment used in WMT benchmarks and industry
mqm_overview.scoring: Errors weighted by severity (Minor, Major, Critical) and category importance

minor.name: Minor
minor.definition: Errors that do not significantly affect comprehension or usability
examples: Minor grammatical error that doesn't obscure meaning
minor.impact: Low - readable and understandable with minimal effort

major.name: Major
major.definition: Errors that seriously impact comprehension, give wrong impression, or require significant effort to understand
major.impact: High - requires re-reading or interpretation effort

critical.name: Critical
critical.definition: Errors that completely block comprehension, convey opposite meaning, or make text unusable

accuracy.definition: How well the translated text reflects the meaning of the source text without adding, omitting, or altering original meaning
accuracy.importance: Most critical dimension - translation must preserve source meaning accurately

addition.name: Addition
addition.definition: Target text contains information not present in source text
addition.severity_guidelines: Minor if harmless clarification; Major if substantial; Critical if completely changes meaning

examples.target: The important board meeting is tomorrow at 10am.

detection_tips: Compare sentence length and information density
Look for explanatory phrases not in source
Check for interpreter's comments embedded in translation

mistranslation.name: Mistranslation
mistranslation.definition: Source content has been incorrectly translated, altering intended meaning
mistranslation.severity_guidelines: Minor if slight distortion; Major if significant change; Critical if opposite meaning
detection_tips: Validate proper nouns and named entities

omission.name: Omission
omission.definition: Content present in source text has been left out of target text
omission.severity_guidelines: Minor if redundant word; Major if key information; Critical if essential for understanding

examples.source: Take medication with food and water.
The red button starts the machine.
Do not use if seal is broken.

detection_tips: Count major information units in source vs target
Check for missing clauses or phrases
Verify all numbers, dates, names present

untranslated.name: Untranslated Text
untranslated.definition: Source language text left in target translation without translation
untranslated.severity_guidelines: Minor if proper noun appropriate to keep; Major if terminology should be translated; Critical if essential content

examples.source: Visitez notre site web pour plus d'informations.
examples.target: Visit our site web for more information.

detection_tips: Look for source language words in target
Check mixed-script text (Latin in Chinese, etc.)
Verify intentional vs accidental foreign text

do_not_translate.name: Do Not Translate Violation
do_not_translate.definition: Content marked as 'do not translate' has been translated, or should-be-translated content was not
do_not_translate.severity_guidelines: Major if brand names changed; Critical if legal/contractual terms altered

examples.error: Brand name should not be translated

detection_tips: Confirm UI element names match source

fluency.definition: Extent to which translation is free of grammatical errors and easily read/understood by target audience
fluency.importance: Critical for user experience - poor fluency reduces trust and comprehension

grammar.name: Grammar
grammar.definition: Issues with grammatical correctness including morphology, syntax, and sentence structure
grammar.severity_guidelines: Minor if doesn't impede understanding; Major if requires re-reading; Critical if blocks comprehension

examples.correction: Because of the rain, we canceled.

language_specific.russian: Case agreement, aspect selection, gender concordance
language_specific.hindi: Postposition errors, ergative marking, oblique forms

spelling.name: Spelling
spelling.definition: Incorrect spelling of words in target language
spelling.severity_guidelines: Minor if obvious typo; Major if changes word meaning; Critical if in critical context (medical, legal)

punctuation.name: Punctuation
punctuation.definition: Incorrect or missing punctuation marks affecting readability
punctuation.severity_guidelines: Minor if minor comma issue; Major if changes meaning; Critical if creates ambiguity in critical text

inconsistency.name: Inconsistency
inconsistency.definition: Text contradicts itself or uses different translations for same term
inconsistency.severity_guidelines: Minor if minor style inconsistency; Major if terminology inconsistency; Critical if contradictory information
detection_tips: Use translation memory to catch variants
Check all instances of key terms

register.name: Register
register.definition: Inappropriate level of formality for context (too formal, too casual, inconsistent)
register.severity_guidelines: Minor if slightly off; Major if noticeably inappropriate; Critical if offensive or unprofessional

examples.text: You gotta sign this doc, bro.
One must endeavor to ascertain the veracity of said statement.

language_specific.hindi: आप vs तुम vs तू (respect levels)

character_encoding.name: Character Encoding
character_encoding.definition: Incorrect character encoding causing mojibake or rendering issues
character_encoding.severity_guidelines: Major if affects readability; Critical if makes text unreadable

terminology.definition: Correct use of domain-specific terms and technical vocabulary
terminology.importance: Critical in specialized domains (medical, legal, technical)

inappropriate_term.name: Inappropriate for Context
inappropriate_term.definition: Terminology used does not fit the domain, audience, or context
inappropriate_term.severity_guidelines: Minor if slightly imprecise; Major if wrong domain; Critical if dangerous misuse

examples.error: Colloquial term in medical professional context

inconsistent_term.name: Inconsistent Use
inconsistent_term.definition: Same source term translated differently across text
inconsistent_term.severity_guidelines: Minor if near-synonyms; Major if causes confusion; Critical if safety-critical domain

examples.error: Three different translations for same UI element

detection_tips: QA check all key term occurrences

wrong_term.name: Wrong Term
wrong_term.severity_guidelines: Major if different concept; Critical if dangerous in medical/legal/safety context

examples.error: Array and list are different data structures

style.definition: Appropriateness of linguistic style for target audience and text type
style.importance: Affects user experience and brand perception

awkward.name: Awkward
awkward.definition: Phrasing sounds unnatural, non-idiomatic, or difficult to read despite being grammatically correct
awkward.severity_guidelines: Minor if slightly awkward; Major if noticeably unnatural

examples.text: The deadline of the project approaches fastly.
examples.correction: The project deadline is approaching quickly.

examples.text: We perform an implementation of the solution.

unidiomatic.name: Unidiomatic
unidiomatic.definition: Does not follow target language conventions and typical expressions
unidiomatic.severity_guidelines: Minor if understandable; Major if sounds foreign

examples.error: Literal translation of idiom doesn't work in Spanish
examples.correction: Llueve a cántaros. (It rains by pitchers)

locale_convention.importance: Critical for international audiences - affects credibility

currency_format.name: Currency Format
currency_format.definition: Currency not formatted according to target locale conventions
currency_format.severity_guidelines: Minor if unconventional but clear; Major if confusing; Critical if wrong currency

date_format.name: Date/Time Format
date_format.definition: Date or time not formatted per locale conventions
date_format.severity_guidelines: Minor if unambiguous; Major if ambiguous (01/02/2025); Critical if causes confusion

address_format.name: Address Format
address_format.definition: Address components not ordered per locale conventions

examples.error: Western format used for Japanese address

name_format.name: Name Format
name_format.definition: Personal names not formatted per cultural conventions
name_format.severity_guidelines: Major if disrespectful; Critical if causes identification issues

measurement_units.name: Measurement Units
measurement_units.definition: Units not converted or formatted for target locale
measurement_units.severity_guidelines: Major if not converted; Critical if wrong conversion

verity.definition: Accuracy of factual claims and cultural appropriateness
verity.importance: Critical for trust and avoiding misinformation

cultural_inappropriateness.name: Cultural Inappropriateness
cultural_inappropriateness.definition: Content inappropriate for target culture or potentially offensive
cultural_inappropriateness.severity_guidelines: Major if insensitive; Critical if offensive

examples.text: Give a clock as a housewarming gift.
examples.error: Clocks symbolize death in Chinese culture

legal_violation.name: Legal/Regulatory Violation
legal_violation.definition: Content violates legal or regulatory requirements in target locale
legal_violation.severity_guidelines: Critical - can expose organization to legal liability

scoring_formula.normalization: Scores typically normalized per 100 words for comparison across texts of different lengths
